title: Lead contamination pictures (Oakland Planning & Building Dept.)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting copies of all photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Specifically requesting copies of all photographs related to the 2019 lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Release of the following records, photographs or documents is requested:

1) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The email of October 8, 2019 describes lead contaminated conditions at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, after uncontained power sanding of lead based paint was performed. The email of October 8, 2019 states "Dust is spreading, tenants and neighbors don't know. None of the tenants have received pamphlets", "Dust has escaped the work area to tenants and neighbors space" and "Pictures are enclosed." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of October 8, 2019 is requested. 

2) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019 , with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019, with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

The email of November 4, 2019 describes concerns over unsafe lead-based work practices at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The email of November 4, 2019 states "contamination of new areas", "area left covered with dust, chips and a dirty work glove for the entire weekend", "Waste was not secured in a locked area, bags are covered with dust" and "Pictures are attached." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of November 4, 2019 is requested. 

3) Requesting copies of all photographs taken on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606.

In response to public records request #19-6316 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/19-6316 the City of Oakland released a
Record Detail with Inspection Log related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Inspection Log contains notes related to the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The inspection log states "photos taken, violation verified. Lead based paint being ground off the building without proper containment methods" and "Paint chips, dust and debris being scattered all over site". Release of all photographs taken at the October 8, 2019 onsite inspection at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, is requested.

4) Requesting copies of all additional photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California. Additionally requesting copies of all additional photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released a Notice of Violation, Stop Work Order, and eight photographs accompanying the documents, related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Stop Work Order dated October 8, 2019 describes "Hazardous lead based paint removal and contamination of local area & beyond." The Notice of Violation dated October 12, 2019 describes "Lead based paint debris being contaminating soil and side of building." and "causing lead based paint to contaminate neighboring properties and soil". Requesting release of all photographs which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563. Additionally requesting copies of all photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anders Maxdale

title: Holocaust Surveys

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Surveys
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law. 

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted this year. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

title: Virginia DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Wayne Byun.

communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS ACT REQUEST of 12/15/2022, Reference # M007425-121522 
 
Dear Mercy Loyo, 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR). Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act, Government Code section 6250 et seq. Your request was received on December 15, 2022 and given the reference number M007425-121522 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 
b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant CDCR department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs that may be associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
CA Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Freedom of Information Act Request: FCI Coleman Form Bs
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This is a preliminary response to the below email.

When requesting non-public information, written authorization from the subject of the record must accompany your request. The written authorization must meet the requirements of 28 C.F.R. §16.41(d). For more information about the FOIA, please visit: https://www.bop.gov/foia/index.jsp#tabs-0.

For your convenience, we attached a form DOJ-361, Certification of Identity. If the subject of the records completes this form, we should have the information needed to proceed. The "Authorization to Release Information to Another Person" section of the DOJ-361 must be filled out to provide the requested records to a third party. A current or former inmate should include on the form his/her Federal Bureau of Prisons register number. Please note, proper authorization is required to log and process your request.

If you have questions about this response, please feel free to reply to this email. Alternatively, you may contact the Federal Bureau of Prisons' (BOP) FOIA Public Liaison, Mr. Eugene Baime at 202-616-7750 or 320 First Street NW, Suite 936, Washington DC 20534.

Sincerely,
L. Eichensehr, for
Eugene Baime
Supervisory Attorney

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

title: Edwin H. Land

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Edwin H. Land
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Edwin Herbert Land (May 7, 1909 – March 1, 1991), who co-founded the Polaroid Corporation, along with serving on the President's Science Advisory Committee and President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This search is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: FOIA Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer:
 
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act requesting copies of all records, including video, audio, emails, texts, and other similar documents, whether sent from or received on official or personal equipment in relation to s shooting of Vincent Davis Sr. by Devontay Murray on July 25 2016 at 4:25 p.m on the 6600 block of South Michigan Avenue.

This request includes but is not limited to the following: missing persons report, court hearings, any crime scene photos/videos, 911 calls, cell phone video, case files, incident reports, police reports, interrogation videos/audio, autopsy reports, missing person report, police interrogation video for other people involved in the shootout, and police video of arrests, copies of any POD Camera video, video or photo surveillance, and any associated documentation. Two weeks after the shooting, Murray was arrested and charged with robbing someone near a school or place of worship on the same block, court records show. He pleaded guilty and was serving a four-year sentence at the downstate Vandalia Correctional Center when he was charged with the murder.

I am a producer with Vice News, this request is made for the purpose of news gathering and not for commercial use.
 
I request a waiver of all fees since this request is being made in the interest of the public and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations and activities related to this former public official’s activities. 
 
I request an expedited processing of this request as this information provides great value to public interest and thus is time sensitive. 
 
Sincerely,
Rafa Farihah, 
Vice News, Associate Producer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Solorio

title: Ellie Daneshnia - Highline Public Schools Executive Director of Capital Planning & Construction - EMAILS AND TEXT RECORDS 2019 - PRESENT

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Ellie Daneshnia - Highline Public Schools Executive Director of Capital Planning & Construction - EMAILS AND TEXT RECORDS 2019 - PRESENT
communications.communication:
TO: HIGHLINE PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT

VIA EMAIL:  publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org

RE: Ellie Daneshnia - Highline Public Schools Executive Director of Capital Planning & Construction - EMAILS AND TEXT RECORDS 2019 - PRESENT

I hereby request the following records Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act:

Ellie Daneshnia - Highline Public Schools Executive Director of Capital Planning & Construction - EMAILS AND TEXT RECORDS 2019 - PRESENT

REQUEST FOR EMAIL AND TEXT RECORDS (IN REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT) FOR THE TIME PERIOD 2019 - PRESENT

I request all Email or Text messages of any kind addressed to, copied or "CC'd" to, including sent from Ms. Ellie Daneshnia, via personal or work-specific devices operated by or otherwise under the control of Ms. Ellie Daneshnia or any other Highline Public Schools Employee for the time period January 1, 2019 to present.

FORMAT OF PRODUCTION OF RECORDS

Please provide all email records as stored in their NATIVE .pst (personal storage table) format as stored on agency email servers to keep fees and costs to a minimum.

Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

If these email records cannot be produced in this NATIVE .pst format, explain in exact technical and procedural detail under the Washington State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56) WHY these electronic records cannot be produced as the electronic records are NATIVELY stored.

This request is for the PERSONAL STORAGE TABLE .PST (NOT .msg or .eml files).  If your agency chooses to transform the .pst file to .pdf fees should be applied via a per MB formula as per RCW and bundled for the maximum possible cost savings.

If you must redact information from individual email messages you may do so by unpacking the .pst file, applying redactions, and then repacking the .pst file and then PRODUCE the .pst file as 1 single file for the purpose of applying fees.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of these email and text records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing responsive email records in REVERSE chronological order by date, producing the most recent messages and records first.

SEARCH FOR RESPONSIVE RECORDS

Your agency’s search for responsive email records should involve a good-faith search of all public employee personal devices reasonably believed to contain requested responsive records regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

Also, please provide a reasonably detailed, nonconclusory affidavit attesting to the nature and extent of any search of any privately owned public employee computer, device, or account.

COMMUNICATIONS – DECLINE ALL USE OF GOVQA AND NEXTREQUEST 3rd PARTY PORTAL

Please provide records electronically via direct email attachment. Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully we decline. 

Please do not direct us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email, or via USPS MAIL a USB thumb drive or CD/DVD-ROM Media.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure any agency redactions or exemptions claimed in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

ELECTRONIC PRODUCTION OF RECORDS

Please provide all responsive records via direct email or no registration-no password internet based cloud link via email. 

Thank you.

title: FOIA Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer:
 
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act requesting copies of all records, including video, audio, emails, texts, and other similar documents, whether sent from or received on official or personal equipment in relation to the 
shooting of Londre Sylvester.
 
This request includes but is not limited to the following: missing persons report, any crime scene photos/videos, 911 calls, cell phone video, case files, incident reports, police reports, interrogation videos/audio, autopsy reports, missing person report, police interrogation video for other people involved in the shootout, and police video of arrests, copies of any POD Camera video, video or photo surveillance, and any associated documentation.

I am a producer with Vice News, this request is made for the purpose of news gathering and not for commercial use.
 
I request a waiver of all fees since this request is being made in the interest of the public and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations and activities related to this former public official’s activities. 
 
I request an expedited processing of this request as this information provides great value to public interest and thus is time sensitive. 
 
Sincerely,
Rafa Farihah, 
Vice News, Associate Producer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Solorio
